page.title: 11SCOTSTARVIT TOWER
page.content: There was a house in the shape of a tower on the site in{1475.Sir John {bought the Barony of Tarvit with the {tower in 1611.}It is built of grey stone with a slate roof and{crow {stepped gables.}It is about 150 feet high and is built horizontally with a stair instead of a corridor connecting the rooms.It was last occupied in 1900.{The tower is one of the most {complete examples of its kind in {Scotland.}A P6 class went up the tower. They said that climbing the stairs was hard but the view from the top was breathtaking. There has been a great interest in the tower because {this year is the 400th anniversary of {the birth of Sir John Scot.
